Class MontyHall

  • java.lang.Object
    • MontyHall

  • public class MontyHall
extends java.lang.Object
    The class MontyHall simulates one or several games. Is uses three Door objects to simulate the three doors. One game consists of the following steps
    1. Resets all three doors
    2. Simulates the selection of one of the doors by the player
    3. Simulates opening of an empty door by the host
    4. provide the outcome for switching and not switching door
    Author:
    gvj (gvj@eecs.uottawa.ca)

      Initializes the three doors.

    • Method Detail

      • runGames

        public void runGames(int numberOfGames,
            boolean commandLine)
        Runs a series of Monty Hall games and displays the resulting statistics in a message dialog or on the standard output
        Parameters:
        numberOfGames - the number of games to simulate
        commandLine - if true, sends the results as CSV to standard output, else uses a message dialog

      • oneGame

        public void oneGame()
        Simulates one Monty Hall game.
        1. Resets all three doors
        2. Simulates the selection of one of the doors by the player
        3. Simulates opening of an empty door by the host
        4. prints the outcome for switching and not switching door to standard output

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method of this program. Examples of the execution of the program from the command line: 
         > java MontyHall 5
 
 Number of games played: 5
 Staying strategy won 2 games (40%)
 Switching strategy won 3 games (60%)
        Selected doors:
                door 1: 1 (20%)
                door 2: 3 (60%)
                door 3: 1 (20%)
        Winning doors:
                door 1: 1 (20%)
                door 2: 1 (20%)
                door 3: 3 (60%)
        Open doors:
                door 1: 2 (40%)
                door 2: 2 (40%)
                door 3: 1 (20%)
        Parameters:
        args - (optional) the number of games to simulate
